alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 9:57PM PDT until November 05 at 12:53PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain associated with an atmospheric river has come to an end this evening. The Puyallup River near Orting will crest just above major flood stage Friday night. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Puyallup River Near Orting. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16,000.0 cfs, the Puyallup River will cause major flooding from Orting downstream through McMillan to Sumner. Swift and deep flood waters will inundate roads...residential areas... and farms. Erosion will likely damage levees. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Puyallup River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM PDT Friday the flow was 15,900.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river will crest near 17,000 cfs late Friday evening. It will begin receding early Saturday morning and fall below flood stage by midday Saturday. - Flood flow is 10,000.0 cfs. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16,500.0 cfs on 11/25/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 600 AM PDT.
